abstract: The world’s largest retailer paid its chief executive $29.7 million last year after sales grew at the slowest pace in more than two decades.
snippet: The world’s largest retailer paid its chief executive $29.7 million last year after sales grew at the slowest pace in more than two decades.
lead_paragraph: Wal-Mart Stores, the world’s largest retailer, paid its chief executive, H. Lee Scott Jr., $29.7 million last year after sales grew at the slowest pace in more than two decades.

headline.main: Wal-Mart Reports Its Chief Was Paid $29.7 Million in 2006
headline.print_headline: Wal-Mart Reports Its Chief Was Paid $29.7 Million in 2006
